talk tuna the one i want you to use for
this is the way more expensive olive oil
packed tuna it's just a much better
product for this pasta then those cans

not only is the tuna going to be a

that end she'll be kind of breaks down
and disappears into the oil
besides disappearing the anchovy the
other thing that's happening here is
we're given those capers a little saute
it's going to sort of concentrate that
briny flavor a little bit which is going
to create a very flavorful foundation
for the rest of the sauce so like i said
we're going to saute that on medium for
about two minutes and then we're going
to add some finely minced garlic and
stir that in and don't walk away we
don't want to brown this we don't want
to color this we just want to sizzle
this for about one minute and what'll
happen if you walk away
you'll get distracted and it will burn
and you'll have to start over or even
worse you won't start over you just keep
going and it won't be any good so be

about a minute and at that point we're
going to splash in some white wine about
a 1/2 a cup and you know we always want
to use a drinkable wine when we cook at

medium-high because we want to reduce
this by about 75% alright and i'll show

season this up a little bit i'm gonna go
with some hot red chili flakes a good
amount this is supposed to be a little

we'll stir that in and then like i said
we're going to keep reducing this down
until basically you have about 25% left
of what you started with which should
look something like this
all right at that point we're going to
go ahead and dump in our tomato product
and I'm using San Marzano crushed
Tomatoes and the good news here is you

puree fresh tomato concasse pretty much

this is the perfect point to remind you

we're going to stir in our tomatoes
we're going to bring that back up to a

then all I want you to do before we add

but I do like to let it simmer a little

minutes and then we can go ahead and

going to officially recommend you break

last but not least we're going to go

plan
all we're going to do is lower that heat

is the next step so I'm going to go
ahead and boil some nice fat spaghetti

going to cook this about a minute under
how we normally would cook it because we
want to finish this with that hot sauce
so we're gonna slightly undercooked that
and then we're going to go ahead and
drain it and don't let it sit there too
long as soon as you dump it in I want
you to transfer that right back into the
pot alright I don't want that pasta
getting all dry and sticky and then
we're going to immediately pour over our
hot sauce we'll give that a thorough
mixing and then what we'll do is we'll
simply cover this for about three
minutes and thanks to the residual heat
in that pasta and sauce the spaghetti is
going to finish cooking perfectly and
you know if you watch other pasta video
here we never just dump sauce on top of
naked pasta that's simply barbaric so
this is the way to go if you want your
pasta absorb extra flavor from the sauce
so we're going to mix that thoroughly
we're going to pop on the lid and we're
just going to let it sit like that cover
it for about three minutes and at that
point you're ready to serve into a warm
